results.title: The efficacy of atenolol in the outpatient management of the alcohol withdrawal syndrome. Results of a randomized clinical trial.
results.text_hl: Levels of @<m>DISEASE_Pleoconial_Myopathy_with_Salt_Craving</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C564883 @@@craving@@@ for @CHEMICAL_Alcohols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000438 @@@alcohol@@@ were strongly associated with treatment failure; the group of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who received @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ included significantly fewer who reported high levels of @<m>DISEASE_Pleoconial_Myopathy_with_Salt_Craving</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C564883 @@@craving@@@ 24 hours after treatment began (7% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and 20% of those receiving placebo).

citations.NLM: Horwitz RI, Gottlieb LD, Kraus ML. The efficacy of atenolol in the outpatient management of the alcohol withdrawal syndrome. Results of a randomized clinical trial. Arch Intern Med. 1989 May;149(5):1089-93. PMID: 2719503
citations.BibTeX: @article{2719503, title={The efficacy of atenolol in the outpatient management of the alcohol withdrawal syndrome. Results of a randomized clinical trial.}, author={Horwitz RI and Gottlieb LD and Kraus ML}, journal={Arch Intern Med}, volume={149}, number={5}, pages={1089-93}}

results.title: Randomized controlled trial in alcohol relapse prevention: role of atenolol, alcohol craving, and treatment adherence.
results.text_hl: Randomized controlled trial in @CHEMICAL_Alcohols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000438 @@@alcohol@@@ relapse prevention: role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Alcohols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000438 @@@alcohol@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Pleoconial_Myopathy_with_Salt_Craving</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C564883 @@@craving@@@, and treatment adherence.

citations.NLM: Gottlieb LD, Horwitz RI, Kraus ML, Segal SR, Viscoli CM. Randomized controlled trial in alcohol relapse prevention: role of atenolol, alcohol craving, and treatment adherence. J Subst Abuse Treat. 1994 May-Jun;11(3):253-8. PMID: 8072054
